I spent hours looking through old pictures yesterday, and every one has her grinning from ear to ear. I love this picture of her.
I always saw my achievements as mom‚Äôs wins, too ‚Äî and I think that‚Äôs how she viewed them.  I think it‚Äôs fair to say that I would be nothing and nowhere without her.
She was the fun, generous mom and aunt, and the grandmother who never said no to her grandkids.

She literally lived for her magnificent grandchildren, the loves of her life, insisting to me that she loved them more than I did, and, thankfully, she lived long enough to develop real relationships and make memories with my children.
She loved being a school teacher, but she saw her number one job as teaching and raising me and my sister Emily.

To me, Gwenn Kuskin Feldman was always larger than life. She was beautiful and graceful, with a smile that would light up any room and a laugh that could be heard for miles.  She loved to tell stories, often the same ones over and over ‚Äì they‚Äôre legendary.
I can‚Äôt thank everyone enough for the outpouring of love and support these last days. My mom was one of a kind and I will miss her every day. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DnKOf-YVYAAlhrU.jpg
